Oth-Temp spike could be from the progesterone or it could be a positive sign. An embryo implants anywhere from day 6 - 11, but usually day 6-7 post ovulation, meaning that u r are currently 8 days post ovulation. Everyone is different with symptoms and the meds play funny tricks on us. Also you have hcg in your body up to 14 days from the hcg injection(usually 2 days prior to retreival/ovulation). Stay positive and busy-mentally, physically take it easy.Don't test until your are at least 11 days post transfer, you don't want to test too early and get a false negative. Hang in there.Amy - the price we have to pay to have babies... I experienced severe weight gain all over when I was pregnant with my dtr - I here that girls usually do that to you. That is why this time I was positive it was a girl, I still look 4-5 months pregnant. I noticed weight gain in my face especially, plus my hair went so oily and I started breaking out - I never break out not even when I was a teenager.  If you were a runner, you will be again. You will lose the weight and have a nice little pink bundle too.As for me, I met with my RE doctor today and got the good news that I can try again as soon as my AF returns. Since I would have an additional AF after starting the suppresent meds and prior to the injections. So hopefully my AF comes sooner than later.

Still trying to come to terms with my luck in remembering the password after so long, I have decided to post one more time before going to bed. It is almost 6 months since my first IVF cycle and I am back to square one, a bit poorer and much fatter :).  Hmmm. I have come off the folic acid and even though we baby dance, I do it now not with the expectation of getting pregnant....which makes the dance not as interesting.Lots of questions enter my mind, did I choose the right clinic, was it my fault, was it theirs, was it simply not meant to be at the moment. Even with this last attempt, I was hopeful even though there was blood on the catheter after the transfer, but nothing, nothing, nothing but disappointment and fat. I have started to modify my diet and do a bit more exercise but I have to do better. I would like to lose a few pounds, let my body adjust and then try again. But I do not want any medication in my system in June or July. If I were younger, let us say, if I were younger than 35 perhaps I would have taken a year off from all of this. But I can only take months.Do I go back to the clinic that I know or do I try a new one where there are fresh eyes? Or am I just wasting money as the REs do not really know what is going on but just try by a process of elimination?I have to do this IVF thing one more time just so that when I am grey I would not be saying "what if I had tried one more time?" I have to be stoic about all this otherwise I could not cope. I have not been posting recently, except for tonight, nor have I been discussing it with others. I am not sure what is worse - carrying the burden alone (with God's help) or wasting time confiding in people who simply talk out your business and stress you out more? I have opted for the former, apart from my chatting on this site...Life is truly about choice and decisions. As, to the best of my knowledge, my question is male factor, I could find another man. But then what? I would lose the one who does not mind spending his life with me....Isn't life something else? It is easier to find a sperm donor than it is to find a good husband. I think that I will leave it here rather than try in one night to overcompensate for my absence.

LJ, your posting gave me a fright! :)) I never for one moment considered that there are risks associated with a hysteroscopy. After reading your posting, I went on google and there I saw them. Hmmmmm. Thanks so very much. The RE had suggested a hysteroscopy because she cannot understand why on the one hand I had good embryos but poor implantation. I just hope that all these exploratory procedures do not result in my being worst off.How long will you have to wait for another appointment? I hope not too long...Audrey and Nickimike, thanks too for the advice. The appointment with the next RE is the first Monday in August. I was thinking of cancelling it as he might have an expectation of my continuing but DH said no...I guess he has a point in us getting another opinion. But there is only so far we can go if we have no intentions of moving forward. I would not want to pay for exactly the same type of tests. I will see if he suggests a different route that I am more comfortable with but he would have to do really well for this to happen. I am hoping that I get better monitoring this time and that it would work out and so I am tempted to go to the RE that I had the appointment with in July. She does not live too far from me and so if there is a problem, I should have someone who is treating me quite close to hand Today I was in a store looking at flat screen tvs and I saw a couple with a baby. My first thought was, I would prefer to have the baby....Audrey, you do seem to be enjoying life. Congrats!!!! For me being happy seems like an achievement rather than something that is normal :)Mstrex, congrats! I am looking forward to reaching the waiting stage again although it surely is not the best. But it would mean that the injections would be largely over. I am wishing you all the best.Mommie2b, Monday is just around the corner...I wish you all the best too.

Yeah Mstrex - here's to twin minimum sticky dust!!!!!  Sending lots your way.  So excited for you girl!!BeMy- keep your head up girl. You're doing really good hearing all the scenarios presented.  Keep us posted.Sweedy - how are you girl?  Hope you're doing ok and focusing on those next steps.LJ - your coming up soon.  Are you ok with starting around the 15th still?  I know your bummed about RE not being there to do the ET.

my BB's are soooooo sore and feeling heavy. There are blue veins showing as well. (TMI). All good signs or is it just the prog and estrace?????Am I just getting my hopes up and over analyizing things????Opinons.!!!!!!!!!

Mstrex  - It could be the meds or it could be a good sign. Stay positive. My fingers are crossed.Bemyyear - I would only do the the hysteroscopy if you failed a second time. There are so many factors to IVF, it is a science - and it not exact. I had excellent quality embryos and a very healthy uterus but it took me three fresh cycles of IVF to have my son. And even this last year, second fresh cycle that led to pregnancy. If you have symptoms of something else like fibroids that consider this, but if not I wouldn't risk it.Hope everyone else is well. Happy 17 weeks to Nicki and 32? to Toni:)

girls - thanks for all your very positive words.  Last few days I was busy talking to a ton of doctors and getting opinions on whether i should get my laparoscopy done to get rid pf my endo or if i should go for another round of IVF.Finally we decided to go for another round of IVF as i was told that laparoscopy may reduce my ovarian reserve.  In fact my doc even said that if i wanted i could start fresh cycle this cycle it self on day 21.I havent yet decided whether its going to be this cycle of next.  But i have a week and a half so am taking it easy.2year - what was your result?mstrex - i am keeping my fingers crossed for youLJ - u are to start very soon isnt

LJ, I do not know what to do. I will go to the second RE and see what approach he suggests and then make a decision. Thanks for putting me on the alert though, particularly as I have a retroverted uterus and the procedure might be even more difficult.All, I was just reading Sweedy's comment about a laparoscopy reducing one's ovarian reserve. I did not know this. The first RE I went to wanted to do one, but as he was so incompetent doing another procedure, I got scared and then went to the clinic where I did the first IVF. I remember the RE at this clinic told me that it would have been pointless doing a laparoscopy because the scar tissue that would result would make natural conception more difficult if not impossible.I do hope that I would be successful with IVF2. The time is going so fast. It is almost a year since I did the first one and I am hoping that this year would be-my-year, hence my name. If this does not succeed, I will probably change my name to "AllforJesus" or something of the sort.Nicki, congrats on your progression. I wish that I could have twins, but I prefer to have twin girls. Of course if I were to have boys like you, I would also be happy. Right now, one child healthy child would be fantastic. Having two stops me from having to have another fresh or frozen cycle.All, I would like to change jobs but I do not want to change and then get pregnant. If I had changed since last year, it would have been okay for me to get pregnant now without the employer disapproving. But I did not know that IVF 1 would have been such a flop.

Hi all,Rene - glad everything went so well for you.  I think next time I am going to do 4 also.  Just relax and don't over-analyze.  It is going to work for you I have a good feeling.  You are in the same boat as my brother and his wife - it worked for them the first time but they miscarried and now it worked again the second time.  And it will for you too and you will end up with a healthy babe!Mommie2b - hope everything went ok today - I am blowing baby dust your way.Sweedy - sounds like you got lots of advice and I am glad you are trying again.Bemyyear - I agree with LJ.Nicki - the weeks are flying by!Audrey - sounds like you are having a great summer - one trip after another.  I look forward to being 2ww buddies!LJ - you must be getting excited - only a few weeks!Toni - any news?I start the Lupron on Thursday - hopefully I won't get the horrible side effects.  Keeping my fingers crossed.  Take care!!

I had a hysteroscopy and I have a retroverted uterus. It took only a couple minutes and was not at all painful. My doctors had me do the hypersalpingogram to check the tubes and the hysteroscopyto make sure that the uterus looked fine and had no problems,  before they even tried any ivf .....prior to spending the money on a fresh cycle. Fotunately, as a result we just learned I had a "perfect looking" uterus..he showed the pictures to my husband....and then we proceeded to have a a successful ivf cycle. I haven't met anyone who's had any side effects in the slightest. Hopefully, you'll trust this doctor and get some good advice. It's all confusing!!Only one more week of work for me and then I'll be free like Audrey! Although I don't have near as fun plans...33 weeks done for me. I hope to get things ready for the baby...and relaxing as I grow bigger.Keeping my fingers crossed for all of you girls!!! I just had anohter friend get a BFP after 5 IUI attempts failed...and her first ivf cycle got canceled a week before retrieval becuase of a hormonal problem so they did a 6th IUI instead and now she's pregnant....

Amen to that LJ.... see Bemyyear... 3 fresh cycles for LJ and 3 fresh for me before it worked.  LJ has a beautiful boy and I am PG.  Remember what I said a while back.  I saw that statistically it takes an AVERAGE of 3 tries at IVF before a successful PG.  So we all have to hang in b/c for some it works in 1 or 2 times but for many others it takes 4,5 or 6 times.Amy - congrats on the 33 weeks.  and and extra congrats on your friend.  I love hearing wonderful news like that.  Just goes to show with a little faith and luck anything can happen.  Did you have your shower yet? I'm sure you did.  How is the soon to come princess room?  I'm sure you're busy preparing at this point.  Only a few weeks to go!!Mstrex - I like the sound of those symptoms.  But like LJ said.... it can be the meds BUT it can mean great news too so I'm praying for ya.Deb- Good luck with the Lupron.  I hope so much that it does the trick and it gets you back on track.  Hope those nasty side effects stay far away.Sweedy - wow that's fast.  Take your time deciding.  Very glad to hear you can jump back in when you are ready.Hugs to all.

nicki - i felt really good reading your comments about 3 tries.  I have just done 1 fresh and 1 frozen cycle.  So may be i will get there is i try another time.  I was thinking yesterday about how happy you must feel now.  Like for me this seems like my ONLY problem in life and i feel like if i overcome this i will be released of this and free to be truely happy.bemyyear - keep the faith, we WILL get there.  our job is to keep trying - that is the most we can do - lets do that and leave the outcomes to the one aboveDebbie - thanks for your words and best of luck to you tooamy - good to hear that things are progressing well.

Amy, Nickimike, Old Debbi and Sweedy, thank you for your very helpful and encouraging comments. It is good to have you and the others to chat with, particularly as I have not been discussing IVF with anyone else, apart from DH and the RE.  I will let you posted on whether or not I have the hysteroscopy.Amy, congrats on reaching 33 weeks. I hope that we will be all there some day! I am so eager to buy a cradle and clothes etc., but I must wait.Sweedy, you said that IVF seems like your only problem in life. I must hand into you. I have a couple problems worse than IVF. My greatest problem is my mother's failing health. Sometimes I feel that if she dies, I would too and it would be easier as I do not have kids. I trust that God would give me the strength when the time comes. If I have a kid, it would be easier to justify living given that there would be someone who really needs me and who I would need to live for. Anyway, let me stop being so morbid....

Hi all,Everything went well yesterday.  As I mentioned, my regular RE was on vacation, this RE was nice but a little cocky, when I asked why she wasn't using the u/s to transfer the embryos so told me she has been doing it over 25 years and she 'just knows".  She also made the decision for me not to transfer 4 but 3..... Now for the dreadful 2ww. I have decided not to do the hpts this go around and to just wait. I know about day 8 or 9 I will change my mind.  I have my fingers, legs, eyes, and everything else crossed!Sweedy -- Sorry to hear about your mother's health. I will keep you in my prayers.Amy - Congrats.. Hopefully I will be receiving congrats soon... ;-)Mstrex - Keep the faith.. Stay positive.. My BB were sore before the transfer so it can definitely be the meds.  Just remember to take it easy...As for me, I'm going back to bed before DH walks in and catches me on the computer. Bedrest is so hard!! I rented 6 movies. I think I'm going to need 6 more.... :-))    Baby dust baby dust baby dust....

This bed rest suckssssssssssssss. I am so tired of being in one room. My husband freeks out if I get up to get a glass of water. And If I have to pee one more time I will scream. It seems I am running to br every 10 min. Thank goodness Re said I could get out of bed tomorrow but could only do light things. I am medicial leave for two months and that will drive me crazy as well. Ugggh. I bought hpt (6 of them) before the transfer as I know I will test probably Sat or Sun as Beta is on Monday. I am feeling some sharp cramping on both sides and hope that is the little ones digging in for a long nap. SSBD to you and hope we will be due at same time.!!!!!!!
Okay ladies, did hpt(day 5pt) and got neg. this happened last time too I am sure it is toooo soon. Last time I got pos on day 8 so will test again then.

I can't believe it.  I posted a bunch of personals and it doesn't show up.  UGH.  Let me see if I can recall everything.But first Mstrex you crazy girl you.  Yes, 5 dpt is way to early so wait a bit.  I know it's hard.  What i had said in my post that never showed up is that I still feel the 2ww is the hardest part.  You get used to the u/s, the blood draws, the injections, heck even the ET & ER but that bed rest is the worst in my opinion b/c no matter how many movies you rent or how you preoccupy yourself, you are still alone with your thoughts and it can drive you nuts.Bymy- I'm so sorry to hear about your mom's health.  But remember, life is for the living and your mom would never want you to feel as though you wouldn't want to be here if she weren't.  Plus, God has great things in store for you.  Believe in that no matter what.Sweedy- I so understand your last comment to me.  And yes, for a long time it seemed like not having a baby was the only obstacle to happiness in my life.  I had such tremendous highs and lows its crazy.  Now all I want if for you girls to join me in success b/c I'm so fond of each of you.  And take your time deciding to jump right back.  Take a breather.  I think that's what helped me the last time.  I had 3 months off.  But if you jump right back on... Great.  No matter what.LJ- so are we starting in a couple days or what?  Come on girl.

Hi all,Rene - that is too early to test!  With donor eggs (or embies), you can test in a week, but only a blood test.  My RE said the over the counter tests won't show up that early.  Be patient - testing now will make you crazy!Bemy - so sorry about your mom - both my parents passed away in the last year and a half and it is really tough, but life is still worth living and they would want me to be happy.  Your mom wants the same thing for you.Mommie2b - how are you doing?  Resting I hope.Amy - wow you are really getting close.  It's hard to believe so much time has passed.  Congrats to your friend!Nicki - I agree with you about the multiple tries.  I did one fresh and 2 frozen and nothing worked.  I figure the fourth time will be a charm.  My RE says sometimes its your time and sometimes its not.  We just can't control the implantation process yet.  Glad you are doing well!!I had my first Lupron shot today so I am waiting for the hot flashes!  My brother and his wife (also donor IVF) are at 6 weeks and heard the heart beat this week so they are ecstatic.  I am keeping my fingers crossed - at least I'll have a nephew!Take care!!

Same here. I have been experiencing some cramping as well. My BBs feel like I have two sand bags on my chest. WOW!Nicki - I'm glad the two days of bedrest is over. You are right. I was thinking about what I did wrong the last time that I could prevent this go around.OldDebbi - Don't worry. Hopefully, you don't experience any hot flashes. I also suffered from fibroids and had surgery twice. I decided no more surgery which is the reason I became a vegetarian. My last surgery was two years ago and so far so good. I could just remember the gynecologist saying to me... a man of course.... hurry up and have some babies. Was this the best and only advice he could give to me.  I guess I don't have to tell you I haven't been back to him.

Hi all. I went out of town for a couple days to get some real R&R before I have to go back to work on Tuesday. I started my first set of meds yesterday and have an u/s booked for the 13th. If all is well I will start the 15th or 16th.mommie2b - Your symptoms sound really promising. Fingers are crossed.mstrex - I hope the test goes well.Nicki - How are you feeling? I don't want to hear that you feel like a house, at least not yet.Deb - How are you doing? Any hot flashes yet? The meds I started give symptoms of menopause -fun... I am so happy for your brother & his wife.Sweedy - I don't know how a laprascopy and ovarian reserve could be connected. I had a laprascopy a few months before my very first IVF cycle, they make a small incision at your belly button and insert a small camera for a look around. Good luck on your next IVF.

I am exausted and still quit sick they were born at 34 weeks.. I just got home today... Will update later

Beta came back BFN. We will try again late Sept. Good luck to all the others testing today.

Toni - Congratulations! I am so happy that everything went well and that you made it to 34 weeks. How are you feeling? Welcome Riley and Ryan. Hugs to you all.mstrex - I am sorry about the BFN. There is nothing comforting to say but to stay positive and look ahead to trying again.Audrey - Mine is April 13. I happy to hear from you and that you are having a great summer break.

Toni - Congrats!!!  That is wonderful news.  Take care of yourself and try to get some help.Rene - so sorry - that is tough.  I am glad you are trying again in September.Mommie2b - when are you testing?  I also had two myomectomies for fibroids.  Glad my doctor never said anything like that altho I wish I had started much earlier in my life!LJ - glad you got some rest - now you will be ready for the whole process next week.  My fingers are crossed already.Audrey - glad you had a great time.  Boy I would love to have the summer off!!No hot flashes so far but I do have a few joint aches.  Nothing bad at this point so hopefully I will be lucky!  Take care all!

Mstrex - Sorry to hear about your results .. stay positive..September is around the corner.Deb/Audrey - August 13th is the big day for me. Hey All.  Man I missed a lot.Yeah Toni!!! Congrats on your delivery.  Hope you feel better real soon and your little guy does ok and comes home real soon.  I'm sure you have your hands full.  I'll be joining you in 5 months!Rene - girl I am so especially sorry for you.  I was really thinking this was it. Sticky baby dust to you!LJ - I feel great really.  Sunday will start my 5th month.  Do you believe it?  I'm 1/2 way there!!  And YEAH for you.  I didn't know if you were definitely starting and so happy to hear that you did!!! I'm super excited for you.  XOAudrey - that's cool about starting a birthday chain.  Although you guys will ALL have to celebrate with my first.  My b-day is Thursday!!! I'm 20  14.  Get it... twenty fourteen ..  hee hee.Deb - how's the Lupron going?I'm feeling well.  Waiting for my AFP test to come back.  Hopefully it will be good news.  I don't really have any complaints and have my next appointment next week when I am 5 months!  I can't believe how fast it's going now.  My oh my.B-day list (copy and paste into your message when you add yours)Audrey - Sept. 10LJ - April 13Nicki - Aug. 9

Hi Ladies,Took me a while to catch up since June.  Time surely has flown by. I took some time off to clear my head and during that time my Grammy passed on unexpectedly.  This year has truly been an emotional roller coaster, but I'm back and encouraged.Toni- Congratulations on the birth of the boys...So exciting!!!Nicki- Wow, you've progressed so fast.  Sooo happy for you!!!!Deb- We can get you through until January.  This circle of women is a tremendous support, as you know.Audream- Glad to see that you have truly enloyed your summer.  My DH started his school year last week.LJ- So glad that things worked out and you're starting the next cycle.Audrey - Sept. 10LJ - April 13Nicki - Aug. 9Nikki- Oct. 1

Audrey - Sept. 10LJ - April 13Nicki - Aug. 9Nikki- Oct. 1Amy- July 30thJust had my birthday-so it willbe quite awhile before we get to mine again. Looks like NIcki's is super close! Happy birthday.Congrats to Toni! That is so exciting. ANy news on when Riley gets to come home? I am wishing you all the best. Bringing home two is going to keep you very busy. What a double blessing!!Nikki- I am sorry to hear about your Gram. It's so hard to when someone goes unexpectedly. My Grandpa was the same way. I still think about him everyday.Audream- I am so gla dyou are enjoyign your summer. SOunds like you have made the most of everyday! Enjoy these last few weeks. My class has just gon off track. I am in the midst of adjusting to vactation life. I've been doing a lot of work so far though getting ready for the baby. BUt that is fun work.Tomorrow I am going back to school to get ready for my maternity sub. I am having mixed feelings about being gone. I know I will feel good when the baby is here...I just think having worked for so many years, it's hard to imagine being gone. I am sure if I were one of those super young moms it wouldn't be that big a deal. I get to create a whole new identity...mom. I guess I never believed it would happen...I'm due September 17th-21st...somewhere in there. Based on my IVF dates it should be the 17th...but my doc came up with the 21st off of one of my early ultrasounds..so who knows. I can't wait. Less than 6 weeks to go if she's full term...such a miracle!!!LJ- how are you doing on those drugs?  am looking forward to hearing about your ultrasound. It's just around the corner. Is this the ultrasound to see how many eggs? or just checking the condition of the lining or ovaries?...sooooo many ultrasounds in this whole process.
HAPPY BIRTHDAY NICKI !!!!!!

But no matter what, the time you will have with your little princess will take away any doubt you had.  Enjoy it.  And it's not like you can't change your mind a year or two later and give it an go working again.LJ- hope your doing ok with the meds.  What are you on this cycle?  When is your ER going to be? Do you know about when?  I'm so excited for you.
Thanks LJ!

Happy Birthday to you...cha cha cha...Happy Birthday to you...cha cha cha...Happy Birthday Dear Nicki...Happy Birthday to you!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!And many more girl!  Hope you have something fun planned...whatever it is...enjoy...you deserve it!!!AND I know that you've already received the best birthday gift ever!!   XOXONikki,Sooo good to hear from you again...missed you girl!!  Is your DH on the year round schedule?  Have you decided what your next plan of attack will be?LJ,How are you feeling? Hope your cycle is going well.Amy,Yeah, school's out!!  Cannot wait til little Sierra comes...you and DH must be so excited!!  How are you decorating her room?  Is there a certain theme?Mom2be,How are you holding out girl?  Sending you lots of prayers and sticky baby dust!!!  Countdown to the 13th!!  Are you going to POAS?Deb,How are you doing with the Lupron?  So far so good I hope.  How is your furbaby doing?Bemy/Sweedy,How r u 2 doing?  Any possible dates yet?DH and I went to go see ER yesterday...we still had not done a follow up visit for the last cycle.  He said he really recommended us trying at least 2 more fresh cycles before adoption...so we'll see what happens in Jan. Happy Birthday Nicki...Hope you enjoyed your day..Audrey - I'm doing pretty well.. NO HPTS!!  I'm going to wait until the 13th.

Hello everyone, the board has been rather busy these last few days..which of course is a good thing. Mstrex, sorry to hear about the BFN. A BFN is truly a BFD- a big fat disappointment. Keep thinking of the next steps. I find that when I think of the next steps, I am happier.Mommy2selena, congrats!!! Well done. I am happy to hear about the birth of Riley and Ryan. For you at least one mission has been accomplished.OldDebbi, Nickimike, thanks for the kind regards regarding my mother.Audream, yippee!!! I am so glad to hear that you are trying again. We have had a similar history regarding BFNs.Audream, LJ, Amy and everyone, I had my consultation with the second RE who works in a different country. Her view was that a hysteroscopy is unnecessary and carries risks. Of course I remembered LJ. She said that she would not interfere with the uterus particularly as the ET would be done weeks after. She noted though that in some countries REs insist on patients having hysteroscopies. Here I am hoping that things go well for me, as they did for Amy. LJ's words are at the back of my mind.  I have decided to go with the RE, who unfortunately has advised a hysteroscopy...only because she lives in the same country as me and I am hoping that my stress levels would be less. Provided that the hysteroscopy does not show up anything untoward or that I do not suffer complications as a result of stupidly doing the hysteroscopy, I will do IVF 2 in September/October 2007 and if it fails, I then plan to have IVF 3 with the second RE who resides in a different country. I guess this would have to be in December/Jan 2008 - a whole year after IVF1.Sweedy, do not give up the fight!!! Hang in there with us. Keep thinking of the next steps. One of these days, God willing, your dream will be fulfilled. Have you considered changing clinics or getting a second opinion as to the likely reason for the failed cycle and FET?
Oth2007, I just realised that we have not heard from you in a while. Are you having one or two or is it too early to tell?
